item.title: Nonlinear Transverse Conductivity in Antiferroic Types of Magnetic Toroidal Metal
item.description:
Author(s): T. Miyamoto, M. Shimozawa, S. Hosoi, M. Yatsushiro, K. Izawa, Y. Ōnuki, D. Aoki, and S. Hayami

We have performed careful measurements of nonlinear transverse conductivity (NLTC) at zero field in the intermetallic compound HoAgGe with two distinct magnetic toroidal (MT) structures. Below 7 K (MT1 phase), the NLTC signal becomes observable and significantly increases with decreasing temperature…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076502] Published Fri Aug 15, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): T. Miyamoto, M. Shimozawa, S. Hosoi, M. Yatsushiro, K. Izawa, Y. Ōnuki, D. Aoki, and S. Hayami

We have performed careful measurements of nonlinear transverse conductivity (NLTC) at zero field in the intermetallic compound HoAgGe with two distinct magnetic toroidal (MT) structures. Below 7 K (MT1 phase), the NLTC signal becomes observable and significantly increases with decreasing temperature…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076502] Published Fri Aug 15, 2025

item.title: Direct Evidence of Intrinsic Mott State and Its Layer-Parity Oscillation in a Breathing Kagome Crystal Down to Monolayer
item.description:
Author(s): Huanyu Liu, Wenhui Li, Zishu Zhou, Hongbin Qu, Jiaqi Zhang, Weixiong Hu, Chenhaoping Wen, Ning Wang, Hao Deng, Gang Li, and Shichao Yan

We report direct spectroscopic evidence of correlation-driven Mott states in layered ${\mathrm{Nb}}_{3}{\text{Cl}}_{8}$ through combining scanning tunneling microscopy (STM) and dynamical mean-field theory. The Hubbard bands persist down to monolayer, providing the definitive evidence for the Mottne…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076503] Published Fri Aug 15, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Huanyu Liu, Wenhui Li, Zishu Zhou, Hongbin Qu, Jiaqi Zhang, Weixiong Hu, Chenhaoping Wen, Ning Wang, Hao Deng, Gang Li, and Shichao Yan

We report direct spectroscopic evidence of correlation-driven Mott states in layered Nb3Cl8 through combining scanning tunneling microscopy (STM) and dynamical mean-field theory. The Hubbard bands persist down to monolayer, providing the definitive evidence for the Mottness in Nb3Cl8. While the size…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076503] Published Fri Aug 15, 2025
item.dc:title: Direct Evidence of Intrinsic Mott State and Its Layer-Parity Oscillation in a Breathing Kagome Crystal Down to Monolayer
item.dc:creator: Huanyu Liu, Wenhui Li, Zishu Zhou, Hongbin Qu, Jiaqi Zhang, Weixiong Hu, Chenhaoping Wen, Ning Wang, Hao Deng, Gang Li, and Shichao Yan

item.title: Local Dzyaloshinskii-Moriya Interactions Driving Quasi-2D Magnetism in a Centrosymmetric Nanoskyrmion Material
item.description:
Author(s): S. H. Moody, P. J. Bereciartua, S. Francoual, M. T. Littlehales, M. N. Wilson, M. Gomilšek, M. T. Birch, D. A. Mayoh, G. Balakrishnan, and P. D. Hatton

The unabating discovery of nanoskyrmions in centrosymmetric magnets challenges the conventional Dzyaloshinskii-Moriya (DM) skyrmion stabilization mechanism. We investigate ${\mathrm{Gd}}_{2}{\text{PdSi}}_{3}$ using polarized resonant x-ray scattering and find that the low-field incommensurate modula…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076706] Published Thu Aug 14, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): S. H. Moody, P. J. Bereciartua, S. Francoual, M. T. Littlehales, M. N. Wilson, M. Gomilšek, M. T. Birch, D. A. Mayoh, G. Balakrishnan, and P. D. Hatton

The unabating discovery of nanoskyrmions in centrosymmetric magnets challenges the conventional Dzyaloshinskii-Moriya (DM) skyrmion stabilization mechanism. We investigate Gd2PdSi3 using polarized resonant x-ray scattering and find that the low-field incommensurate modulations are elliptical helices…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076706] Published Thu Aug 14, 2025
item.dc:title: Local Dzyaloshinskii-Moriya Interactions Driving Quasi-2D Magnetism in a Centrosymmetric Nanoskyrmion Material

item.title: Excitonic Effects in Phonons: Reshaping the Graphene Kohn Anomalies and Lifetimes
item.description:
Author(s): Alberto Guandalini, Francesco Macheda, Giovanni Caldarelli, and Francesco Mauri

We develop an ab initio framework that captures the impact of electron-electron and electron-hole interactions on phonon properties. This enables the inclusion of excitonic effects in the optical phonon dispersions and lifetimes of graphene, both near the center ($\mathrm{Γ}$) and at the border ($K$…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076401] Published Wed Aug 13, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Alberto Guandalini, Francesco Macheda, Giovanni Caldarelli, and Francesco Mauri

We develop an ab initio framework that captures the impact of electron-electron and electron-hole interactions on phonon properties. This enables the inclusion of excitonic effects in the optical phonon dispersions and lifetimes of graphene, both near the center (Γ) and at the border (K) of the Bril…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076401] Published Wed Aug 13, 2025
item.dc:title: Excitonic Effects in Phonons: Reshaping the Graphene Kohn Anomalies and Lifetimes

item.title: $1/5$ and $1/3$ Magnetization Plateaux in the Spin $1/2$ Chain System ${\mathrm{YbAlO}}_{3}$
item.description:
Author(s): P. Mokhtari, S. Galeski, U. Stockert, L. Behera, S. E. Nikitin, R. Wawrzyńczak, R. Küchler, M. Brando, L. Vasylechko, O. A. Starykh, and E. Hassinger

Quasi-one-dimensional magnets can host an ordered longitudinal spin-density wave state (LSDW) in magnetic field at low temperature, when longitudinal correlations are strengthened by Ising anisotropies. In the $S=1/2$ Heisenberg antiferromagnet ${\mathrm{YbAlO}}_{3}$ this happens via Ising-like inte…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076704] Published Wed Aug 13, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): P. Mokhtari, S. Galeski, U. Stockert, L. Behera, S. E. Nikitin, R. Wawrzyńczak, R. Küchler, M. Brando, L. Vasylechko, O. A. Starykh, and E. Hassinger

Quasi-one-dimensional magnets can host an ordered longitudinal spin-density wave state (LSDW) in magnetic field at low temperature, when longitudinal correlations are strengthened by Ising anisotropies. In the S=1/2 Heisenberg antiferromagnet YbAlO3 this happens via Ising-like interchain interaction…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076704] Published Wed Aug 13, 2025

item.title: Separating Terahertz Spin and Charge Contributions from Ultrathin Antiferromagnetic Heterostructures
item.description:
Author(s): T. W. J. Metzger, P. Fischer, T. Kikkawa, E. Saitoh, A. V. Kimel, and D. Bossini

An experimental approach that combines high external magnetic fields with symmetry analysis is able to separate spin and charge contributions in terahertz emission spectroscopy of antiferromagnets.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076702] Published Tue Aug 12, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): T. W. J. Metzger, P. Fischer, T. Kikkawa, E. Saitoh, A. V. Kimel, and D. Bossini

An experimental approach that combines high external magnetic fields with symmetry analysis is able to separate spin and charge contributions in terahertz emission spectroscopy of antiferromagnets.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076702] Published Tue Aug 12, 2025

The anomalous metal state (AMS), observed in “failed” superconductors, provides insights into superconductivity and quantum criticality, with studies revealing unconventional quantum phases like the Bose metal. Recently, layered transition metal dichalcogenide (TMD) superconductors approaching the t…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 076501] Published Mon Aug 11, 2025

Recently, layered transition metal dichalcogenide (TMD) superconductors approaching the t…

item.title: Observation and Control of Chiral Spin Frustration in BiYIG Thin Films
item.description:
Author(s): Jinlong Wang, Hanchen Wang, Zhewen Xu, Artim L. Bassant, Junfeng Hu, Wenjie Song, Chaozhong Li, Xiangrui Meng, Mengqi Zhao, Song Liu, Guozhi Chai, Peng Gao, Wanjun Jiang, Desheng Xue, Dapeng Yu, William Legrand, Christian L. Degen, Rembert A. Duine, Pietro Gambardella, and Haiming Yu

Chiral spin frustration can be identified and controlled via scanning nitrogen-vacancy magnetometry and spin pumping.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066705] Published Fri Aug 08, 2025

item.title: Strong Kitaev Interaction in ${\text{BaCo}}_{2}({\mathrm{AsO}}_{4}{)}_{2}$
item.description:
Author(s): Pavel A. Maksimov, Shengtao Jiang (蒋晟韬), L. P. Regnault, and A. L. Chernyshev

Inelastic neutron scattering results together with analytical and density-matrix renormalization group numerical analyses point to a dominant Kitaev term in the model description of BaCo2(AsO4)2.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066703] Published Thu Aug 07, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Pavel A. Maksimov, Shengtao Jiang (蒋晟韬), L. P. Regnault, and A. L. Chernyshev

Inelastic neutron scattering results together with analytical and density-matrix renormalization group numerical analyses point to a dominant Kitaev term in the model description of BaCo2(AsO4)2.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066703] Published Thu Aug 07, 2025
item.dc:title: Strong Kitaev Interaction in ${\text{BaCo}}_{2}({\mathrm{AsO}}_{4}{)}_{2}$

item.title: Mapping Delocalization of Impurity Bands across Archetypal Mott-Anderson Transition
item.description:
Author(s): M. Parzer, F. Garmroudi, A. Riss, T. Mori, A. Pustogow, and E. Bauer

Tailoring charge transport in solids on demand is the overarching goal of condensed-matter research as it is crucial for electronic applications. Yet, often the proper tuning knob is missing and extrinsic factors such as impurities and disorder impede coherent conduction. Here, we control the very b…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066302] Published Wed Aug 06, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): M. Parzer, F. Garmroudi, A. Riss, T. Mori, A. Pustogow, and E. Bauer

Tailoring charge transport in solids on demand is the overarching goal of condensed-matter research as it is crucial for electronic applications. Yet, often the proper tuning knob is missing and extrinsic factors such as impurities and disorder impede coherent conduction. Here, we control the very b…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 066302] Published Wed Aug 06, 2025

item.title: Chirally Protected State Manipulation by Tuning One-Dimensional Statistics
item.description:
Author(s): F. Theel, M. Bonkhoff, P. Schmelcher, T. Posske, and N. L. Harshman

Chiral symmetry is broken by typical interactions in lattice models, but the statistical interactions embodied in the anyon-Hubbard model are an exception. This is an example for a correlated hopping model where chiral symmetry protects a degenerate zero-energy subspace. Complementary to the traditi…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 063401] Published Mon Aug 04, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): F. Theel, M. Bonkhoff, P. Schmelcher, T. Posske, and N. L. Harshman

Chiral symmetry is broken by typical interactions in lattice models, but the statistical interactions embodied in the anyon-Hubbard model are an exception. This is an example for a correlated hopping model where chiral symmetry protects a degenerate zero-energy subspace. Complementary to the traditi…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 063401] Published Mon Aug 04, 2025
